intro: Danaea draco, commonly known as the dragon's blood plant, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, crimson-colored sap, which has been historically used in traditional medicine. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Danaea draco thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Its unique appearance and medicinal properties make it a notable species in botanical studies.
